Comment: Management of account master related reference data
DBAG_Long Description:
The AM platform allows the management of account related reference data for the ICSD business needs.
This includes in a first step the management of descriptive data to set-up an account (account name, classification, address, etc), then the most critical settlement related data linked to risk limits and collateral details.
The AM platform offers as well the management of currencies related data, as rates, deadlines, etc.
The AM platform interacts as well with the NCCIP interest calculation, by providing all the underlying account specific calculation rules and reference data.
The AM platform provides the distribution of reference data to dowmstream applications, for example SAP, Custody, Nostro, Datawarehouse.
The AM platform offers as well a large number of internal reports of reference data, as well as combined securtities and cash related reporting.
The AM platform is offering the management of the Target2 directory.
Since November 2013, AM is offering the management of the Agent (Depositories) for Position Management application and a new data model to be T2S compliant in order to prepare 2016 T2S implementation.

C7 was designed to meet a changing regulatory environment, while at the same time bringing the scalability and flexibility needed to meet evolving product opportunities and high volume demand.

Key features of the C7 clearing architecture: 
·	Unique system design to support clearing of listed and OTC products (for both derivatives and cash) on a common architecture.
·	Superior client clearing support for different business models based on EMIR compliant segregation models under a configurable account structure.
·	Shorter time-to-market for launching new products and greater responsiveness to changing regulatory demands.
·	Streamlined transaction management through a harmonized processing model and through enhanced netting options across all markets cleared.
·	Simplified system integration through market standard and low footprint interfaces.
·	"Future-proofing" with the elimination of dependencies on end-of-lifecycle technologies.
·	23 hours a day, 6 days a week availabilit.

·	Validation
·	Request consents
·	Transfers
·	Netting/compression
·	Published valuation measures

Comment: Processing of RegisteredShares in CSC business
DBAG_Long Description:
CASCADE-RS includes all functions related to the processing of Registered Shares in CSC business.
The functionality of CASCADE-RS can be split into two main aspects:
·      Routing of instructions from banks to issuers (of registered shares) and vice versa (where the message handling itself is provided by LIMA) including the verification of instructions.
 
·      Detailed position keeping/ handling for banks on shareholder level, meaning banks are mirroring the registered shares positions of their customers’ accounts within CASCADE-RS .
 
The functions in detail are:
Registration of shareholders:
Following a capital increase or the initial issue of registered shares shareholders have to be initially registered. The bank instruction contains the shareholder data (name, address, date of birth etc.), the number of shares and references the underlying capital increase. A message is sent to the issuer and the CASCADE-RS position for the shareholder is created.
 
Re-registration:
The re-registration instruction results from a trade in registered shares. It contains the data of the buyer (name, address, date of birth etc.) and the number of shares. 
Then a matching of previous shareholder positions to the re-registration instructions is performed (3 times a day).
A message is sent to the issuer and the CASCADE-RS position for the shareholder is created at time the positive feedback has been received from the issuer.
 
De-registration:
The de-registration instruction results from a trade in registered shares. It references the seller and contains the number of shares being sold. The referenced shareholder position in CASCADE-RS is freed and the information (shareholder id and amount) held in the Previous Shareholder Pool until it is used by the matching process for re-registrations  (see above).  
This function is closely integrated with the CASCADE system. 
For mass de-registrations CASCADE-RS provides a function to de-register all positions of one security or of one bank across securities. This is used for example for squeeze-outs.
 
Update of shareholder data:
In case the personal data of a shareholder (name, address) changes, the bank enters an Update Shareholder Data instruction. As not the complete shareholder data is kept in CASCADE-RS, an update of data might or might not occur. Anyhow the instruction is routed to the issuer.  
Instructions can be entered on single ISIN level (via data transfer or online) or for all ISINs within one shareowner-account (only online).
 
Cross border securities Transfer
Securities Transfers are possible in the link between Monte Titoli, Euroclear France, DTC, APK and CBF.  For transfers of holdings from other CSDs to CBF messages are sent to the share registers, the additional holdings at CBF are reflected using a technical shareholder. For transfers from CBF to other CSDs the registered shares holdings at CBF are reduced by de-registering shareholders in the unregistered positons queue. Messages for those de-registrations are sent to the share registers. 
 
Transfer of registered positions:
In case the bank account of a shareholder changes this change has to be reflected in CASCADE-RS. 
Two kinds of this instruction type have to be differentiated: Internal and external, where internal means, the shareholder account changes within the same bank organisation and external meaning a shareholder has transferred his account to a different bank. 
Based on this instruction the positions in CASCADE-RS are shifted and an information message is transferred to the issuer.
This function is closely integrated with the CASCADE system.
For mass account changes, which occur at bank mergers or when the accounts within one bank are restructured, CASCADE RS provides a function (RS CEDAR) to generate instructions to transfer the registered positions impacted. The input for this function might be a general algorithm or a migration file from banks containing each position with its old and new identification.
 
Corporate actions:
As the CASCADE-RS positions reflect the bank positions on a more detailed level, all corporate actions changing the amount of shares have to be performed on the CASCADE-RS positions. E.g. in case of re-nomination the shareholder positions have to be altered in the defined ratio.
This function is triggered by the KADI system.
 
Deposit/Delivery of individual certificates:
In case individual certificates for a certain equity still exist, a deposit or delivery to respectively from CSC might occur. For deposits in registered shares the certificate numbers and shareholder data is being verified against the information provided by the issuer. In case of successful verification shareholder positions are created and a message is sent to the issuer.
This function is triggered by the VAULTS system.
 
External Reconciliation:
Besides the internal reconciliation CASCADE-RS provides a function to reconcile its shareholder positions against the ones contained in the issuer’s share register. This is done on request of the issuer. The information can either be provided on an individual basis or regularly (daily, weekly, monthly etc.) 
 
Capital increase information:
Whenever a capital increase takes place for an equity contained in CASCADE-RS this has to be reflected synchronously within CASCADE-RS and the affected share register. In CASCADE-RS – triggered by the VAULTS system – a position is generated reflecting the amount of shares waiting for registration.
In order to ensure synchronicity with the share register a message is sent containing the capital increase data. 
 
Previous shareholders information:
As CASCADE-RS keeps the information of shareholders already being de-registered by the bank but only transfers this information combined with a re-registration for another shareholder the deregistration will reach the share register days or weeks after the deregistration has been entered by the bank. Therefore CASCADE-RS provides an information file with all shareholders marked for de-registration (“previous shareholders”) to share-registers .
The information can on request either be provided on an individual basis or regularly (daily, weekly, monthly etc.). 
 
Information on unregistered bank positions
In order to inform issuers about the volume of unregistered positions per bank a fix format file is produced on request and sent out to the issuers.
 
Technical/nominee re-registration:
In order to immediately (on a daily basis) de-register all shareholders marked for re-registration CASCADE-RS provides a function for registering a bank specific (on bank’s request) nominee or common technical shareholder for all unregistered positions. Issuers can request this function.
 
Master and Control Data
For entry of issuer master data and control data CASCADE-RS offers an online interface.
 
Queries and report of holdings
CASCADE-RS offers the online entry of requests of LIMA Queries or report of holdings. Bank users can define the range of holdings they want to receive information on, e.g. ISIN or account number range can be specified. LIMA queries provide the information in a file format ready for further processing, the report of holdings is a printable report.   
 
CASCADE-RS consists of Online and Batch. Online functions being used for instruction entry and information retrieval on instructions or positions. They can be used by banks directly and provide real time information.
Instructions alternatively can be entered using the LIMA interface or  S.W.I.F.T. Additionally there is an online transaction restricted for internal usage (KCEZ). This one is used for entry of RS specific master data and for controlling/triggering of processes (external reconsiliation, exclusion of certain ISINs from re-registration).
Main processing within CASCADE-RS occurs in Batch mode.
 
As mentioned above CASCADE-RS is closely integrated into the CBF applications, especially CASCADE, VAULTS, KADI.  
 
For master data it uses the common applications WSS (securities) and KUSTA (customers – banks and issuers).

Comment: Cash Instruction Lifecycle for new German Settlement Model
DBAG_Long Description:
Cash Lifecycle handles the complete life cycle management for pure cash instructions within the New German Settlement Model. Cash Lifecycle supports the following processing cycles
 
·            Via procedure 6  (P6):
o     STD, SDS1, SDS2
o     C1F1, C1F2, C1F3
o     C2F1, C2F2
 
·           Via procedure 3  (P3):
o     DD1, DD2, DD3
 
·           GC Pooling Select
 
Processing logic and interfaces for all P6 related cycles are identical with the only exception, that custody, Market Allocation/Reversal, and X-CSD instructions are only considered for STD processing.
 
In detail the following business areas and instruction types are supported:
 
Liquidity Management (P6)
·            Reservation instructions:
They can be created manually by using the Cash Lifecycle online functionality. Beside this, standing instructions can be used to trigger the automatic creation of reservation instructions based on a fixed cash amount defined in KUSTA or the cash requirement calculated by the Cash Forecast application.  Reservation instructions can also be entered in applications of Deutsche Bundesbank and are in this case forwarded electronically to Cash Lifecycle.
 
·            Reservation Reversal instructions:
Those are created by the application to reverse the original reservation booking at the end of the settlement cycle. In addition, dependant on the settlement result, Utilisation or Payout Instructions are created.
 
·            Utilisation instructions are automatically generated in case of a negative settlement result for an account. 
 
·            Payout instructions are automatically generated in case of a positive settlement result for an account. 
 
·            Funding Transfers can be used to transfer cash liquidity from cash funding accounts to cash settlement accounts. They will be produced automatically based on rules defined by customers via online
 
·            Realignment Transfers are used to transfer remaining cash liquidity after settlement from cash settlement accounts back to cash funding accounts. They will be produced automatically based on rules defined by customers via online
 
·            Market Allocation Instructions:
These are built on market allocation rules defined by customers to transfer cash from a CSA to a MAA. Should the definitions for MAAs in KUSTA not be in sync with CL’s own rules, the CL rules will be updated accordingly to enforce their consistency.
 
·            Market Reversal Instructions
Reversal of the market allocation instruction based on CASCADE balances
 
X-CSD Instructions
For pending purchases these are created based on pending cash amounts delivered by CASCADE.
For new purchases these are created based on the difference between the balances of the Market allocation and Market reversal instructions
 
Cash Instructions (P6)
·      Custody Cash instructions (NTP):
These are generated by the Cash Lifecycle system based on information delivered by the KADI application.
 
Cash Instructions (P3):
·      The Custody Cash Instructions (DTP) and Non-Custody cash instructions:
These are based on automatic deliveries from KF-Geld, KADI and/or manual input.
 
GC Pooling Select
Monitoring of Cash Management for institutional clients (non finachial institutions) on a prefunding bases in Central Bank money:
·      Interface from LIMA:
Real-time creation andupdate of cash movements
·      Creation of Pay-Outs:
Depending on pending settlement instructions pay-out instructions are created, further status updates depend on LIMA feedback (SEME needed)
 
 
Services offered for instructions via Cash Lifecycle are:
 
o   Manual instructions management
o   Approval of manual instructions
o   Verification of manual instructions
o   Automatic generation of instructions
o   Data validation
o   Netting
o   Packaging
o   bookings
o   Online queries 
o   Interfaces to Settlement applications are supported
 
The functionality/usage and screen layout of the application was designed and developed taking CASCADE as a paragon. As such it is divided into online (IMS DC) and batch components and provides the following functionality :

Comment: Core Creation Settlement Engine
DBAG_Long Description:
The CSE application is the core settlement system for RTP, DTP and night time boxes S1, EB1, EB2. The following functionality exists within it:
1.	§ Settlement activity
o Sequencing : instructions for settlement are sequenced prior to processing by customer and Clearstream sequencing rules.
o Provision checking : availability of assets is checked prior to settlement
o Netting : instructions are netted together as opposed to settling instructions sequentially
o Settlement : modification of positions, credit lines and statuses of instructions to effect final settlement.
§ Financing activity
o Cash financing : if insufficient liquidity exists on the customer account, cash can be borrowed against the customers credit lines.
o Securities financing : if insufficient liquidity exists on the customer account, securities can be borrowed from lenders against the customers credit lines.
§ Loan management (ASL and ASLplus programmes)
o Loan reimbursement : during netting and settlement post processing, both cash and security loans are reimbursed should liquidity be available.
o Credit line adjustment : during settlement post processing, if credit exists on cheaper cash credit lines, then loans on more expensive credit lines are reimbursed and recreated on the cheaper line.
o Automatic collateral substitution : substitution of specific collateral is required when the borrower has outstanding deliveries in an instrument he is pledging, or where he is pledging and borrowing the same instrument, or where cash is being pledged.
o Automatic Lender Substitution : one lender is substituted for another when the original lender has a pending delivery or lending limit problem
o Collateral Top-up and Return : this process will collateralise loans which have become under-collateralised (due to asset revaluation). It will also return collateral to the pledger if he is over-collateralised.
o Manual Loan Creation : loans entered manually through the loan workstation are created in the CSE.
§ Asset Revaluation : the CSE will periodically re-value all credit lines, loans and collateral in the system, in response to price changes.
§ Sharing of Collateral and Credit : accounts can share cash credit lines and collateral pool within an umbrella structure
§ Processing of custody events
§ Collateral Usage : for customers and regulatory authority

Comment: Lifecycle Management for Stock Exchange trades
DBAG_Long Description:
Description of the business functions supported by the application
 
LION is the application used for the life cycle management of stock exchange trades (non-CCP).
 
Stock exchange trades are routed from Deutsche Börse (XONTRO) and CCP application once a day via file transfer into the LION application. Customers of Clearstream can manage their positions by using the LION online or file transfer facility.

Besides the blocking and unblocking of trades LION also foresees the possibility to split the settlement of a trade into various parts (partial delivery-> Teilebelieferung).
 
Dependent on the underlying position, due trades are routed for settlement from LION to the CASCADE Settlement Engine (for CSC business) three times a day and to ICSD Systems (Settlement/Cash Services) (for NCSC business) twice a day.
 
The settlement result is routed back from these applications to LION where the positions (open trades) of the customers are updated, and the information about settled trades is forwarded to the “Settlement reporting.
For information to the customers LION provides – in addition to the available online queries – various reports (e.g. “LIST OF PENDING S.E. TRANSACTIONS”) and messages  for “Pending Stock Exchange Trades” (MT537) and “Settlement Confirmations” (MT 545/547) via LIMA (S.W.I.F.T.)

Comment: Lending Management System
DBAG_Long Description:
Clearstream Banking offers its customers an automatic fails lending for deliveries against payment. This is done by a lending system, which core part is the Lending Management System LMS.
Clearstream Banking does not join the settlement lending itself, but acts as an agent between borrower and lender. This model is embedded in existing settlement structures (CASCADE, LION).
The lending system supports two business types: settlement management (automatic lending) and strategic lending.
 
Clearstream Banking initiates and returns settlement management trades without involving the customers particularly. This happens through an automatic allocation in which trade suggestions are generated (considering the stock of potential lenders and the fails of potential borrowers). These trade suggestions are listed in the “Dispo Mask” and can be changed if needed. Automatic lending trades are automatically returned by LMS.
 
Strategic trades (except KAGplus) are entered in LMS by the trader manually. LMS exports the openings and the returns to the backoffice at the requested date.
In the same way, LMS allows the management of collaterals, virtual positions and trades with virtual positions.
 
Since 2014 the sources of FX rates can be prioritized and Rights can be traded within the KAGplus business.
 
Since 2013 loan trades can be opend using a non EUR price of EUR. For this functionality multicurrency prices and FX rates are provided to LMS by WSS. Ability a lot af Aditionally new reporting features were implemented.
Master data export to Smonitor and new reporting channel via Secure Copy and Secure File Transfer have been prepared for using.
Since November 2012 information about collateral for LMS entered in CMAX is available electronically and can be made visible in detail on LMS reports.
 
Since April 2012 Reuters prices are available. For the purpose of extension of the strategic lending business and lendigspecialized trade entry for GSF London has been made possible.
 
Since November 2011 additional corporate actions are available in LMS for automatic processing. Automatic fee calculation in LMS has been enhanced to the needs of the billing process.
 
Since May 2011 settlement on CBL settlement platform creation is possible. Xemac collateral positions have been made visible in detail in LMS reporting.
 
Since June 2010 the LMS trade number is available in MT544/MT546 CASCADE Settlement Confirmations and MT536 CSS for reconciliation purposes on customer side. 
 
Since November 2009 all trade openings are checked against pre-defined eligibility criteria. Eligibility baskets can be defined on trade type level on the loan side and on customer level on the collateral side. The definition of the eligibility baskets is based on security criteria delivered by WSS. Since September 2010 the EGCP and EGCPX basket definitions are available for eligibility basket definition in LMS. Additionally, an additional interface allows the upload and usage of customized eligibility lists for eligibility basket definition.
 
Since all lending transactions are now booked with immediate finality in the settlement engine of CASCADE due to the introduction of New Daytime Processing, additional exposure management functionality was implemented in LMS. Every loan opening which is sent to CASCADE for settlement must now be collateralized in advance.
 
Since November 2008 for a part of the strategic business (funds lending: KAGplus; KAG = “Kapitalanlagegesellschaft) customers can send instructions to LMS in ISO15022 messages MT540 and MT542 (fully automated interface) or in comma separated text files (semi-automated interface). For the position based KAGplus business lenders can send their lendable assets where borrowers can send requests against. In the automated matching process LMS matches holdings against demand considering predefined customer relationships.
In the instruction based KAGplus business both lender and borrower send prearranged instructions which match in LMS.
KAGplus customers can order intra-day reporting for KAGplus business using ISO15022 messages MT548. Since November 2009 also the automatic cancellation of instructions and trades via ISO15022 messages is possible.
 
In addition LMS carries out a daily fee calculation, in which the open lending trades are considered.
 
Since March 2007 after SDS1 LMS releases Collateral automatically if the affected securities were short in the SDS1 batch settlement or will have a corporate action event on next value date. The collateral substitution must be done still manually.
 
Since November 2006 SOFDIS settlement of all lending and collateral instructions (RTS mode as well as non-RTS) is possible. 
 
Since June 2005 LMS allows the generation of all reports automatically.

Service for penalising CSD participants who do not fulfil their funding requirements for settlement
DBAG_Long Description:
The Settlement Discipline application provides a service to the market for penalising participants who do not fulfil their funding requirements and compensating those who are harmed by their counterpart’s behaviour.  This is done based on a series of rules defined by Clearstream together with the Market, (Market Rules Committee).
 
Securities settlement (DvP sales):
 
In the case of securities settlement fails, i.e. unsuccessful securities provisioning by the required deadline, (end of CBF processing day on Contractual settlement date), penalties will be incurred on the basis of the cash counter value of DvP OTC- Instructions. The required delivery rate is 100%.
Blocking of OTC sales is possible and will be penalised using the same method as fails.
 
Cash settlement (DvP purchases):
 
In case of cash settlement fails, i.e. failure to provide enough cash by the NTP deadline, penalties will be incurred on the basis of unprovisioned cash amounts based on post NTP results.  The required efficiency level is to provide 100% of the required cash amounts for settlement.
Blocking of OTC purchases is possible and will be penalised using the same method as fails.
 
Settlement Discipline enables penalty calculation, collection, distribution and reporting per Cash Settlement account for blocked and failed OTC-Instructions (release 1).
 
CBF business departments and external customers can access the Settlement Discipline application via the internet. The Settlement Discipline GUI provides the functionality to maintain SD-parameters, to create daily reports, reports for a time period and a monthly report monitoring the penalties per customer. All information is available in German and in English language.

2. STOP ensures the real time pre-execution scanning of RTS, CASCADE and NCCIP instructions in order to ensure that suspicious instructions do not enter market processing and thus respecting the following critical aspects:
â€’ Service Delivery: Especially US sanctions regime require that no kind of service is delivered to the customer before an instruction has not been validated against sanctions lists. As the term service is used in a very restrictive way, business validation as part of the market processing is considered as being such a service
â€’ Settlement Finality: This EU directive establishes criteria defining the position in the processing chain of an instruction where that instruction cannot be undone or rolled back either with mutual consent or under no circumstances
This version of STOP is fed data by a Middleware known as MICOS. MICOS is an interface layer between connectivity flows and transaction systems. It implements functionality that aims to reduce the impacts on transaction systems.

Comment: Interface to TARGET2 interbank payment system
DBAG_Long Description:
1.    NTP-Link (NGSM)
This subsystem covers the electronic data exchange of cash balances, which are produced within DBAG back office processes (CBF Cash Lifecycle, CBL EUR NightTime Funding Link) to support the New German Settlement Model, with the NCB (BBk, BcL). All cash reservation requests (before NTP), X-CSD – Transfers for ESES markets, utilisation and pay-out balances (after NTP) are handled.
 
Main functionalities are :
 
·       The creation and administration of payment instructions, which result from cash instructions  from back office processes (NTP) 
·       The creation of end-of-day and contingency reports 
·       Online functionality for the cash clearing and settlement related business departments for the monitoring of cash balances 
·       Sending payments to and receiving payments from the NCB on Target2 via the ASI (Ancillary System Interface).
·       Creation and sending/receiving of control instructions / messages to synchronize DBAG and SSP settlement processes (open and close procedures and cycles)
·       Replicate SSP Settlement Bank data daily via the ICM/A2A (Information and Control Module), use and provide them to back office applications for validation and account mapping purposes
·       Message based interface for actual sending/receiving of payments  in XML formats via tapas.AS and tapas.ICM (IBM product to access SSP via SWIFTNet InterAct and FileAct)
 
Input used for NTP-Link (NGSM):
·       Cash Lifecycle (Dedicated Liqudity Requests, X-CSD – Transfers, Debits and Credits for CBF)
·       Standing and current orders from the SSP (Target2 Single Shared Platform) for CBF and CBL
·       Dedicated Liquidity from the SSP for CBF and CBL
 
Output created by NTP-Link (NGSM):
·       Messages and files for the data exchange with the Target2-SSP
·       Dedicated liquidity files for the back office processes 
·       Several internal reports 
 
2.    DTP-Link (NGSM)
 
This subsystem covers the electronic data exchange of cash balances, which are produced within CBF Cash Lifecycle to support the New German Settlement Model, with the NCB. All cash reservation requests (for all five Cont SDS – Cycles and SDS1/SDS2 cycles), utilization and pay-out balances (at the end of each cycle) are handled.
 
Main functionalities are :

see Bullet NTP-Link (NGSM) except the X-CSD Transfer processing
 
Input used for DTP-Link (NGSM):
·       Cash Lifecycle (Dedicated Liquidity Requests, Debits and Credits for CBF)
·       Standing and current orders from the SSP (Target2 Single Shared Platform) for CBF
·       Dedicated Liquidity from the SSP for CBF
·       Debits and Credits from CBF
 
Output created by DTP-Link (NGSM):
·       Messages and files for the data exchange with the Target2-SSP
·       Dedicated liquidity files for the back office processes 
·       Several internal reports 
 
3.    RTS-direct-cash-clearing
 
RTS-direct-cash-clearing covers the electronic data exchange of the cash balances, which are produced within the immediate disposition of Cascade to support the DvP-process, with the NCB. This function is enhanced by handling of international CBL-Customers as one side of a RTS-instruction. The resulting cash balances are assigned to Ancillary System CBL. For each RTS-instruction one P2000-payment is generated.
 
Main functionalities are:
 
·       The sending of cash-balances, which were created by the immediate disposition of CASCADE 
·       The creation of reports for the customer 
·       Online functionality for the department OBF (CBF) and OBR (CBL) for the monitoring of cash balances 
 
For Self Collateralization there is an additional processing of revocation of RTS instructions at 3:30 pm.
 
Input used for RTS-direct-cash-clearing :
·       CASCADE
 
Output created by RTS-direct-cash-clearing :
·       Several internal reports (CBF)
 
 
4.    Cash Clearing DD1/2/3
 
This subsystem covers the electronic data exchange of the cash balances, which are produced in Cash Lifecycle, via the T2CI (Target2-CashInterface) with NCB. All cash balances from first, second and third cash clearing are handled via P3000–Debits and -Credits.
Main functionalities are :
 
·       The creation of P3000-Payments, which result from cash instructions of Cash Lifecycle(first, second and third cash clearing) 
·       Online functionality for the department OBF for the monitoring of P3000-Payments
·       Setting the LTO after package 9 of both cycles
·       After completion of DD2 processing triggering of KADI interface to CashLifecycle (Procesing of “Geldumsätze”)
 
 
Input used for Cash Clearing SS1/2/3:
·       Cash Lifecycle 
 
Output created by Cash Clearing SS1/2/3: 
·       Messages and files for the data exchange with the Target2-SSP 
 
5.    Eurex-Link
 
Eurex-Link covers the electronic data exchange of the cash balances, which are produced within cash clearing of EUREX respectively CCP, via the T2CI (Target2 Cash-Interface) with NCB
 
Main functionalities are:
 
·       The creation of P2000- and P3000- Debits and -Credits, which result from cash instructions of Eurex cash clearing 
·       The creation of reports for  Eurex Clearing
·       The delivery of notifications for debits and credits via MQ Series
·       Online functionality for the department Eurex Clearing for the monitoring of cash balances
 
Input used for EUREX-Link:
·       File with balances which are created within the systems of Eurex
 
Output created by EUREX-Link:
·       Messages and files for the data exchange with the Target2-SSP
·       Several internal reports
·       MQ Series Messages with debit and credit confirmations
 
 
 
 
6.    Enhanced Contingency Processing:
 
T2CI: For contingency purposes all contingency reports for CBF payments are provided to the archiving tool LDMS and all payment based XML-files created by tapas (third party product) are provided to the BBk Extranet.
In addition, contingency debits and credits are created based on confirmed, blocked liquidity (> 0) for each procedure 6000 cycle.
Moreover, for all payments delivered to T2CI by CL (including the aforementioned contingency payments created by T2CI itself) an alternative XML-Conversion is done via LIMA and also provided to the BBk-Extranet.
 
 
7.    LuxCSD-Link
 
This subsystem covers the electronic data exchange of cash balances, which are produced within LuxCSD, with the NCB (BCL). All cash reservation requests, utilization and pay-out balances are handled.
 
Main functionalities are :
 
·       The creation and administration of payment instructions, which result from cash instructions  from LuxCSD (NTP + DTP) 
·       The creation and sending of a status file after every finished cycle
·       The creation of end-of-day and contingency reports 
·       Online functionality for the cash clearing and settlement related business departments for the monitoring of cash balances 
·       Sending payments to and receiving payments from the NCB on Target2 via the ASI (Ancillary System Interface).
·       Creation and sending/receiving of control instructions / messages to synchronize LuxCSD processes (open and close procedures and cycles)
·       Replicate SSP Settlement Bank data daily via the ICM/A2A (Information and Control Module), use and provide them to back office applications for validation and account mapping purposes
·       Message based interface for actual sending/receiving of payments in XML formats via tapas.AS and tapas.ICM (IBM product to access SSP via SWIFTNet InterAct and FileAct)
 
Input used for NTP und DTP-Link:
·       Dedicated Liquidity Requests, Debits and Credits
·       Standing and current orders from the SSP (Target2 Single Shared Platform) 
·       Dedicated Liquidity from the SSP for CBF and CBL
 
Output created by NTP und DTP-Link:
·       Messages and files for the data exchange with the Target2-SSP 
·       Dedicated liquidity files for the back office processes 
·       Status file for the back office processes
·       Several internal reports

It is highly configurable and can be adapted to the needs of the individual markets, on any level, from the entire market down to individual instrument groups. On the technical side, Eurex Exchange’s T7 provides an outstanding level of reliability and availability, and at the same time it is characterized by a high throughput capacity and by low latency. Comment: The Eurex T7 FIX Gateway allows exchange members to communicate with the Eurex Exchange´s T7 backend using a standard FIX connection.
DBAG_Long Description:
The Eurex FIX Gateway is intended for participants that require a standard FIX connection to the exchange and supports many types of markets.
The Eurex FIX Gateway supports the FIX 4.2 and FIX 4.4 versions of the interface.

The Eurex FIX Gateway provides the following trading functions of Eurex Exchange’s T7:
- Order management
- Execution notifications
- Risk control event notifications
- Creation of a strategy
- Request for quote
- Cross request

Additionally the Eurex FIX Gateway enables participants to subscribe to private trading data in broadcast form:
- Trade notifications at a business unit level
- Drop Copy for standard (not lean) orders at business unit level


The Eurex FIX Gateway is explicitly not targeted at low-latency requirements, but at low frequency sessions (limited to 50 transactions per second). 
Technically, the FIX Gateway implements the fix-protocol and is an adapter translating between the standard FIX interface and the proprietary ETI interface. It leverages the FIX engine (third party product QuickFixJ) an the FIX-Frame library (own implementation) on the client side, and ETI on the trading platform side.
The FIX engine is reused between T7 and XETRA.

Comment: Tax Services (CBL).
Tax service for CBF customers related to withholding tax law
DBAG_Long Description:
The Taxbox application routes information related to the new withholding tax law, valid from 01-01-2009 between banks or other financial institutions.
The underlying business event is a transfer of deposits from one financial institution to another. In this case the financial institution from which the deposit is transferred has to provide the receiver institution with information e.g. about dates and prices of the transferred holdings at which they were bought.
Additionally another message type is covered by Taxbox, which allows the transfer of losses summarized for one account.
 
The main functions of the Taxbox are:
·      Receiving messages from banks concerning information relevant for calculating withholding tax.
·      Perform validations on messages received to ensure formal consistency. Validation results are sent back to the sending institution.
·      Storing messages in backend database.
·      Determine the receiver of the message
·      Bundle and send out messages to the receiving institutions at defined sending cycles 
 
The functions in detail are:
Business Validation:
Incoming messages are validated against business rules, i.e. correct and consistent values according to plausibility definitions etc.. According feedback is sent back to the sender. 
Routing Table functions:
Taxbox uses a so called Routing Table to determine the receiver of a message. The address ID used in the messages is either  the German Banc Identifier Code (“Bankleitzahl” – BLZ) or the S.W.I.F.T. Banc Identifier Code BIC. This  has to be matched to a CBF customer ID (“KV-Nummer”) to whom the message will be sent to.
This matching information is stored in the Routing Table. 
Initially the information is loaded with information received from customers in a standard CSV-file.
Afterwards the maintenance is done via an online function. 
Routing Table entries contain a valid from and valid to date in order to allow even future entries.
The Routing Table online function is only available for CBF users.
An export of the Routing Table in CSV-file format is provided weekly for Business Operations.
 
Message storage:
Messages are stored in a database, adding some organisational fields to the message, i.e. status, date and time etc.
 
Message online service:
Messages can be retrieved online for one year by entering some search criteria such as period of time, sender, receiver etc. 
This function is available for CBF and customer users. Customer users’ access is restricted to messages either sent or received by them.
Additionally the online function allows selecting messages to be resent as a copy of the message. This service is only available for CBF users.
 
Message preparation:
At defined sending cycles (currently four times a day), messages are read out of the message database, checked for completeness, bundled per receiving customer and sent out.

Comment: TEX is the custom-build trading platform from 360T for trading and execution of FX, Money Market and Interest Rate Derivative products. Furthermore it can be seen as a SaaS solution, as it offers also white-labelling features and supports multi-tenancy, multi-product configuration.
DBAG_Long Description:
TEX is the overall name of the 360T platform. It connects the Buy Side clients, which are either Corporates (ca 1000), Banks (ca 400), Asset Managers (ca 100) or Broker-Dealers (<5) and the Sell-Side, which are mainly banks, providing the liquidity.

Nearly 90% of the trades are in the RFS FX spot, forward and swap area, where the Buy-Side requests an offer for a trade from banks/market makers, with whom the customer has a relationship. Liquidity provider answer by providing an offer. The system compares and sorts these offers and the client can decide , which offer to accept. Market makers on the other hand cannot see, which offer the customer accepted. The market maker  receives monthly reports, indicating in which range they are. This trading model is described as RfS (Request-for-Stream).

A different approach is ESP (Executable Streaming Price), where clients can subscribe to a channel, where market makers are constantly streaming their offers for fixed sizes (e.g. 1 M, 3M, ...). Clients can see the spread and decide there for the best offer. In both system all participants can set limits, which get automatically processed, once a corresponding price is offered.

Once a trade is made, the TEX platform generates a Deal Confirmation, which can be automaticcaly  passed on to the treasury / settlement systems. The settlement itself is not done by TEX. Neither any position or risk management (appart from some limits), as 360T is not acting as a central counterparty.

Technically the TEX platform is developed in pure Java and completely by 360T. External libraries are avoided whenever possible. The frontend is currently using Swing, but there is an effort to replace this with JavaFX. In the same move a lot of the business logic will be moved from client side to server side.

TEX can also be configured to be used within one company or for interbank marketplaces, which is called I-TEX. The main frontends are called RfS for Request-for-Stream dealing and SuperSonic Trader (SST) for Executable Streamed Pricing dealing.
Furthermore there is the Market Maker Cockpit (MMC), where the banks can manage the pricing and a Auto Dealing Suite (ADS).

As the platform is constantly evolving, a new version is developed called EMS (Execution Management System), which should unify all the different services into one and which is introducing a more flexible data model.

Comment: Times New Roman;Century Gothic;Courier New;Arial;";;;;Normal;Default Paragraph Font;Vaults and New Issues for CSD
DBAG_Long Description:
Vaults and New Issues Function:
 
CBF in the roles of a central custodian for securities and of a party of DBCo and of the common safekeeper for NGNs (“New global notes”) supports three basic types of “Vault” and “New Issues” activities:
 
·       Instruction-driven activities during the lifecycle of an issue including the issue of new securities/precious metals and the admission services. 
·       Activities due to Vault administration only
·       Event-driven activities coping with income or non-income events out of the custody processing.
And in addition
·       Audit related activities
·       Overall additional vaults services
·       Coupon Collection Service
 
The functionality for the different business units is supported by the IT-applications listed in column “Application Name”. Detailed functionality is as follows
 
 
1.    D/W
The Vaults Deposits/Withdrawals component comprises currently the main functionality:
Deposit and withdrawal
·       Instruction maintenance
·       Validation (incl. compliance check and Certificate numbers)
·       Settlement (via Interface to Settlement Engine)
·       Workflow for certificates examination
·       Providing registered shares related data of deposit instructions to CASCADE-RS
·       Assignment of certificate numbers
·       Calculation of insurance values
·       Logging of CBF-related lifecycle of deposit/withdrawal instructions. Providing online information of the workflow status to CBF business operations as well as to participants and archiving of historical data.
·       Providing monthly statistical data
·       Daily provision of instruction data to LDMS for extended selection requests
 
Deposit and withdrawal instructions are entered by the participants via LIMA or online using CASCADE Lifecycle or “CASCADE PC Front end” for administration of the instructions. For issuing agents participating in special service offers (s.’Functionality to minimise manual processes’) instructions are automatically created by CBF. Instructions are given via CASCADE Lifecycle to CASADE Settlement Engine to be settled by the RTS-method or in the STD settlement processes. Settlement Reporting, LIMA Queries are available as the customer front end for information regarding settled deposit/withdrawal instructions.
 
Deposits and withdrawals are integrated in Settlement Services as a special instruction type. The functionality for the management of the instructions during its lifecycle (e.g. amendment, cancellation, 4 eyes principle,) provided for deposits/withdrawals is aligned with the functionality for OTC-instructions.
 
In general within the term “deposits/withdrawals”, not only the deliveries of physical single and global certificates into and out of the vault are considered but also new issues and the provision and reduction of market volatility “mark up/down”on variable global up-to-certificates  (“Neuzulassung”, “Re-/Valutierung”, “Teilreduzierung”, “Reduktion Rahmennominale”). 
In addition the functionality to care for the special workflow of an instruction concerning physical certificates is provided (e.g. receipt of certificates at the counter, release the deposit instruction for settlement with 4-eyes-principle, confirming the receipt of certificates in the vault, assignment/amendment of certificate numbers to deposit and withdrawal instructions, pre-setting the denominations for batch assignment of certificate numbers to physical withdrawal instructions, confirming each of the packages of a split deposit, calculation of insurance value and transport costs).
 
Functionality to minimise manual processes:
·       Validating the nominal amount of a deposit/withdrawal instruction against the available physical certificates. Particularly Euro-redenominated securities with certificates in non-Euro currencies are considered.
·       Automatic intraday transfer of deposit instructions certificates to the number ledger
·       Automatic update of securities master data for new issue instructions
·       Automatic batch calculation of denominations for physical withdrawal instructions, which have no pre set.
·       Intraday assignment and reservation of certificate numbers and global certificates for physical withdrawal instructions (see CARAD).
·       Automatic creation of markup/down instructions due to OTC-instructions or holdings of issuing agents
·       Processing of new issues/increases of warrants/certificates and also bonds based on EDT-(Electr. Data Transfer) instructions aligned to the special workflow, including  automatic
- reconciliation/matching of deposit instructions
- release for booking
- creation of the associated deposit instructions initiated by file-transfer of Office Automation Application
- confirmation of receipt in the vault
·       
- feedback files with results of automatic reconciliation and booking to Office Automation Application. 
·       Instructions with Considering future settlement dates: automatic receipt and assignment of an entry-number as well as release to settlement for due instructions
 
2.    CARAD
Safekeeping
General functionality regarding certificate numbers, which are used by several online and batch processes:
·       Certificate validation routine (e.g. uniqueness, stop-order),
·       Certificates (number) processing (e.g. change of position in the vault, marking of defect papers, adding special information about peculiarities or adding special remarks/notes
·       Put and extract certificate numbers in and out of strings for comfortable input and clear reporting
 
Functionality for administration of block stocks and variable stocks (single shares and global certificates):
·       Online input/amendment and information (incl. search for a special certificate number in CARAD, D/W).
·       Online functionality to support processes like confirmation and join of blocks, change from frozen to non-frozen blocks, swap from variable to blocked stocks and vice versa
·       Online request for downloadable reports as list layouts and CSV-files (actual and/or historical data, optional in ascending order of numbers or in order of the safekeeping, also sequence of nominal amount changes for up-to-certificates).
·       Information screens and requestable reports and files for issuers/main paying agents and for Vaults Insourcing customers 
(s. Overall additional services)
·       For notification purposes block stocks reports can also be requested via online screen
·       Processing of stop orders delivered by WSS (setting marks in block stocks, variable stocks and D/W-instructions 
·       Automatic update due to corporate action processing
·       In addition to the “second” and “forth” ECHO-process: Automatic list of all certificate numbers which are concerned by a corporate action
·       Assignment and reservation of certificate numbers for withdrawal instructions 
·       Batch sort of certificate numbers for global certificates
·       Storage of historical data about each of the certificates (including archiving)
·       Building and storage of value dated holdings
·       Providing statistics, holdings and processing information (daily/monthly) to CASHII, DNB, RCC.
·       Batch-synchronisation with WSS-updates
·       4 eyes principle for block stocks
·       Automatic change from fixed global certificates to up-to-certificates on request
·       Automatic batch removal of RS certificate numbers on demand
 
 
3.    CARAD
Issuance Monitoring
·       Contains special security master data concerning registration and validation of physical securities. Online information and amendment of this data.
·       The online menu contains also transaction-codes that are not considered as parts of Vaults. The handling of fractional-/full interests (“Teilrechte/ Vollrechte”) is part of CASCADE Lifecycle application and the Entry possibility for Issuer Master and Control Data for registered shares is part of CASCADE RS application.
 
 
4.    ECHO
The current event handling functionality is separated in 4 sub-processes, which are defined as follows:
First sub-process “Preparation”:
Producing event-notification lists in advance and automatic block stocks report for the preparation of vault related event-processing.
 
Second sub-process “Inventory” (batch):
Producing Vaults inventory report.“Copy” the concerned CARAD-stocks as the basic stocks for handling the event. This process takes place one day before execution date.
 
Third sub-process “Reconciliation” (on-line or automatically in the batch): 
Reconciliation action compares the position at the NOSTRO accounts with the physical security amounts.
Online: Information about securities to be reconciled and status of reconciliation. Vault staff confirms the reconciliation. If necessary input/amendment of the “copied” stocks. The result is automatically documented by four Online-Printing reports (incl. special information for deductions).
Batch: Automatic reconciliation for non-effective securities (with/without deductions) and for effective securities (without deductions) where there is no difference of amounts to be detected. 
The online process takes place at the earliest at the execution date. The batch process occurs 1 day before execution date and is included in the second sub-process.
 
Forth sub-process “Delivery/Destroying of certificates”: 
This process involves creating additional reports for documentation purposes, for support of manual processes and for distribution to the lead managers/paying agents respecting their format requests and the securities and event related format requirements.
Delivery of coupons/physical securities to the lead manager or destroying them.
Calculation of coupons/physical securities for reconciliation, Providing information for invoicing of fees for delivery/destroying.
Providing statistic reports.
In addition to this it reconciles the collection amounts to the sum of calculated coupons or redeemed securities considering special tax procedures.
 
This process occurs after reconciliation (third process) has taken place.
 
In all processes redenominated securities with certificates in old currency are considered.
 
Additional ECHO-functionality:
A statistics report about handled coupons is produced daily. It contains monthly and yearly totals.
 
 
5.    Controls
Support of internal audit related processes and provision of information about CBF internal instructions workflow to customers: 
·       Automatic reconciliation in order to detect discrepancies between CARAD and nostro account holdings
·       Online information about pending deposit and withdrawal instructions. Tracking of the workflow supported by logging of status changes in historical data.
Inventory service:
Determining securities with holdings which are available for inventory process.
Online requests for inventory reports on securities ranges. Provision of inventory reports considering the different extent of information depending on the physical certificate formes.
Online confirmation of regular reconciliation processes and providing of reconciliation results.
Storage and archiving of historical data of reconciliation processes.
Monthly reconciliation statistics: Quarterly/yearly reports about inventory activities
 
ECHO and Controls are mainly CBF “internal” applications, main users are the employees of Division Vaults and Securities Admission. Customers do not have direct access to ECHO. Participants use Controls screens to retrieve workflow information regarding their deposit/withdrawal instructions. Via ECHO they receive the documents provided by the fourth process.
 
 
{Overall additional services}
The following additional vault services are overall provided by all or parts of the vault applications:
 
 
·       Admission service level "segregated CSC deposit" ("Vorratslagerverwaltung").
Non-endorsed investment certificates (mainly physical single certificates) with a regular securities identification number are stored separately from CSC and are segregated per customer on subaccounts (bank of deposit for the relevant investment fund) on a contractual basis. 

Those certificates are not on the market yet and have to be physically separated in the vaults. 

The first deposit is done by a normal deposit instruction type, with the advice that the securities have to be credited under a segregated CSD deposit account. 

By receiving specific customer instructions, it is possible to change this form of deposit into CSC. For transfers in or out of the segregated CSC deposit, the vault D/W-function Withdrawal is used with the target account which has been explicitly advised by the customer. The target account can either be the regular CSC account/position type (transfer from SCSC to CSC) or the SCSC account/position type (transfer from CSC to SCSC). 

After the final confirmation of receipt of the relevant certificates in the Vault (segregated or CSD) the process is closed and the final confirmation to the settlement systems takes place. 
 
·       Insourcing “third party” service for banks vaults (individual safekeeping also of non- collective safe custody securities)
On an individual contractual basis customers handover the vaults amounts for safekeeping and administration to CBF. The certificates are deposited and stored separated from CSC vaults amounts for each bank and for each end customers reference-no. Only deposits and withdrawals, no other instructions, are allowed for these holdings. Booking takes place on separated Loro/Nostro accounts per customer.
Certificate related additional information, special remarks and notes, can be stored for the insourced securities.
Special features for certificates related to renewal of coupon sheets n terms of withdrawal assignments, deductions for event related reconciliation and CARAD-Update. Pre-Advice in case of withdrawal to brances. Transfer from one to another end customers holding within one parties vault automated via special form of withdrawal instructions. 
The regular reconciliation is processed customer related. After completion of reconciliation the customer related inventory reports and reconciliation results are released by Controls via online screen for being provided as downloadable files (also multiple orders possible).
 
·       Special Depository Service (“Lagerstellenverwahrung”)
On an individual contractual basis customers vaults amounts of collective and non-collective safe custody securities are safekept and administrated by CBF. The certificates are deposited and stored separated from CSC vaults amounts for each bank but not on end customers level.
Automatic upload of deposit instructions related to the migration of the positions
 
·       Inhouse Collective Custody Service (“Haussammelverwahrung”)
On an individual contractual basis customers vaults amounts are safekept and administrated by CBF. The certificates are deposited and stored separated from CSC vaults amounts on security level and not banks/end customers level.
 
·       Vaults Service for physical precious metals
Physical metal bars are represented like global certificates by the vaults applications. Additionally the metal bar characteristics (e.g. weights) are stored as special remarks/notes. Only deposits and withdrawals, no other instructions, are allowed for these holdings. Booking takes place on separated Loro/Nostro accounts. No direct input/amendment of holdings via online screens is possible (only deletion).
Daily inventory reports are provided for Controls.
 
·       Service for Tefra-D-securities: Automatic processes at the end of Tefra-D blocking period: change of certificates character and creation of instructions to transfer released nominal amounts from temporary to final certificates
Automatic daily reconciliation in order to detect discrepancies between CARAD and loro account holdings
 
·       Donation register service for main-paying agents:
Administration of donations (cash amounts related to coupon payments) on behalf of main paying agents in the meaning of registering the donation amounts (paid, amenable, allocated). Providing of related reporting as list layout and CSV-File-format (Statement of donation account balances,…) and different options for handling of certificate treatments and cash transfers. 
Donation register service is supported with 4-eyes-priciple and a lifecycle management.
 
6.    Coupon Collection Service
Functionality for presentation of coupons for collection for single receipt overdue coupons and coupons of insourced securities (s. Overall additional services):
·       Online input/amendment, confirmation/rejection and information for single receipt coupons 
·       Online input and information for delivered/destroyed coupons (incl. search for certificate numbers of coupons)
·       Online input and automatic batch retrieving of event data steering the coupon calculation process
·       Online functionality for administration of securities master- and event data (Insert, amendments, deletion)
·       “Copy” of the concerned stocks of insourced securities as the coupon stocks to be delivered for collection
·       Reports with certificate numbers of delivered/destroyed coupons 
·       Provision of advices/reports  for main paying agents, customers and delivery banks  list of all coupons which are delivered/destroyed due to presentation for collection
·       Considering tax related processing
·       Automated cash clearing for collected coupons  “payment versus delivery” via Cash-Lifecycle
·       Check of uniqueness of single receipt overdue coupons against coupons of insourced stocks
·       Consideration of stop orders delivered by WSS or within uploaded files in case of foreign securities (flagging of coupons) within data input and coupon delivery process
·       Storage of historical data about coupon stocks presented for collections (including archiving)
 
 
7.    Safekeeper-ProLog
The Safekeeper ProLog Application supports the business processes of CBF in its roles as the CSK (Common Safekeeper) and LVO (LuxCSD Vault Operator)
for Clearstream Luxemburg eg. LuxCSD. It provides all functionality of the workflows regarding the business process from start to end of life of a New Global Note eg. LuxCSD Notes. Several types of messages for the interface communication can be processed (SWIFT, email, fax, fileAct). The application fulfils all documentation requirements within its Logbook functionality.
 
Prolog for business processes of CSK:
 
As of end of June 2006, issuers of international debt securities can opt for a new form of global note, the NGN, to issue international debt securities in global bearer form. The characteristics of the NGN are the same as the existing CGN, except that:
•       the NGN only applies to debt securities in bearer form; 
•       the ICSD records are used to determine the outstanding amount of the issue rather than physical annotations on the global note itself;
•       issuers must sign an agreement with the ICSDs to request acceptance of their securities;
•       if transmitted electronically to the entity appointed as CSK, the NGN will need to be effectuated by the CSK upon authorisation from the issuer.
 
 
Each security will be serviced by a Common Service Provider (CSP) which will be in charge of providing asset services to the ICSDs and a Common Safekeeper (CSK) which will be in charge of safekeeping the NGN throughout its life, appointed by the ICSDs.
The CSK will be Clearstream Banking Luxemburg or Euroclear Bank for securities that issuers wish to make potentially eligible as collateral for Eurosystem monetary policy or intraday credit operations, or the same entity as the CSP, for all other securities issued in NGN form.
 
Prolog for business processes of LVO:
CBL has been asked to establish a CSD in Luxemburg in partnership with the BCL. The name of the new company is LuxCSD S.A..
The Business flows for LuxCSD Global and Dematerialised Notes will be very similar to the existing New Global Notes (NGN) flows in an ICSD world. However, the legal forms (NGN, NSS), and the agent roles (CSP, CSK) that relate to the international market will not be used. Indeed, Business has requested LuxCSD to use its own terminology to avoid risk that LuxCSD participants and operations will become confused when information is mistakenly provided with the ICSD terminology.

Comment: Management of Investment funds
DBAG_Long Description:
Vestima+ is an automated order-routing service that offers a single point of access to order issuers for in-house domestic, third-party, cross-border and off-shore funds.
Vestima+ is called the multi-domestic solution because it recognises the differences between domestic markets and the different needs that arise in each of them.
Vestima+ offers each market precisely what is required to increase the level of efficiency in investment fund processing, including :
· Forwarding orders from order issuers and passing instructions to the relevant order handling agent (in real time or batches)
· Routing order confirmation back to order issuers after receiving confirmation from order handling agents
· Issuing settlement instructions on behalf of participants to the relevant custodian or CSD (in real time or in batches) upon request.
By building on the existing infrastructure in both domestic and cross-border markets, Vestima+ protects investments already made by the market participants. This minimises the need for any new investment, while maximising the levels of automation and the consequent reduction in costs. All a user needs, to route orders and instructions electronically and most efficiently to multiple order issuers, order handling agents and custodians, is a web browser.
Vestima+ provides an open model enabling order issuers to freely choose their preferred,
most efficient settlement route and custody providers regardless of the market in which
they are located.
The network of order issuers has been expanded to include insurance companies and
asset managers, enabling STP for all participants.
Vestima+ also offers reference data management, reporting facilities and support for funds transfer instructions:
· A database of reference data with detailed information about all types of funds
· State of the art reporting functionality enabling timely and accurate trailer fee computation
· Automated handling of customer transfer instructions
IFRD “Investment Funds Reference Data” is a sub-module of Vestima allowing the Clearstream Operations to maintain the reference data for the funds transfer instructions. It is a web browser application allowing to:
· Create and update reference data,
· Bulk update of reference data
· Support several user profiles: read-only, standard, manager

Comment: eXchange Electronic MAnagement of Collaterals
DBAG_Long Description:
The XEMAC functionality supports an effective management of collaterals. 

It currently includes pledging or transfer of collaterals for the following key markets: 
-       Money market transactions and loan of Deutsche Bundesbank
-       Money market transactions and loan fo other NCBs via Deutsche Bundesbank (Correspondent Central Banking Model Collateral Central Bank CCBM Model 1
-       Eurex margining
-       GC Pooling transactions (Multiple Baskets, Multiple Currencies) between CCP and national (CBF), international (CBL)banks or  CBF as fiduciary for non-banks (GCP Select)
-       CMSI – Collateral Management for  Secured Instruments ; CBF acts as fiduciary for the issuer
-       Bank to Bank transactions
-       CBF Security lending (LMS)

Xemac provides its users with the following functions:
-       Concentration of security positions held in Cascade / Creation (NCSC or CSC) intended to use as collateral in a so-called collateral "pool"
-       Entry of Credit & Debit instructions online for settlement location CBF &CBL, via MT542 for settlement location CBF, via CmaX for settlement location CBL
-       Entry of an Exposure Request for settlement location CBL in order to obtain collateral of a specified basket
-       Option for Automatic Provisioning via Exposure Request for settlement location CBL in case of an under-covered claim or insufficient collateral for SDS or RTS GCP trades
-       Option for Automatic Return of collateral for settlement location CBL four times daily
-       Creation and Adjustment of a claim in multiple currencies, that defines the amount of collaterals to be pledged
-       Automatic Allocation and Release due to changes of the claim amount or due to mark to market changes (price, pool factor, inflation-coefficient, exchange rate, accrued interests, haircut) in the securities value, In addition, concentration limits are considered within the GCP Equities Basket per ISIN and per Clearer ID. For Eurex Margining, an overall concentration limit per ISIN is considered. Furthermore, own issues are excluded in all GCP and Eurex Margining (classic) claims.
-       Allocation Optimisation considering the usability of a security with regards to the customer portfolio.
-       Re-Optimisation process after re-evaluation in the morning in order to consider changes to the collateral pool 
-       Daily eligibility check and evaluation of the allocated securities
-       Multiple Reuse of “GCP” collateral for national customers within GC Pooling and towards dedicated other claims
-       Reuse of “GCP” collateral for international customers within GC Pooling and towards CmaX for further reuse to BCL (Banque Centrale du Luxembourg)..
-       Exclusive Reuse of GCP baskets against Eurex Margining claims for national and international customers; which means that  Option for Automatic Claim Decrease in case of insufficient collateral for SDS or RTS GCP trades.
-       Support of CBF as fiduciary for non-banks participating as collateral provider in GC Pooling, i.e. definition of separate participant type for which received collateral out of GC Pooling is automatically allocated to Eurex Margining and on the other hand automatically released due to the GC Pooling term leg and additionally transfer of allocation reports to the Eurex CRE (common reporting engine) in order to provide the information to the non-bank customers.
-       Substitution on-screen
-       Automatic Substitution for a debit instruction
-       Automatic Substitution of reused collaterals within GC Pooling
-       Ad-hoc collateral pool evaluation based on an exposure
-       Query in order to check eligibility of a security with regards to the customer portfolio
-       CBF users only: Ad-hoc collateralisation + optimisation for an exposure, price check per ISIN in order to retrieve available price data received from external parties
-       Extensive reporting
-       MT569 Summary and Detail Report “Collateral and Exposure Statement” MT527/MT558 for Exposure Management (Adjustment and Notifications)
-       MT558 for Collateral Notifications
-       Suspension of cash flows due to income events for CBF and CBL collaterals pledged to Dt. Bbk or another NCB (accompanied with a cumpulsory claim decrease) and Termination of approval of the collateral taker (Dt. Bbk), Communication with Dt. Bbk via MT527 and MT558
 
Xemac has an automatic interface to Cascade and uses Real-Time-Settlement. In addition there exists a MQ Series link to CmaX via LIMA using MT527 and MT558 messages.
 
Xemac daily downloads several EADs (eligible asset databases) from the ECB homepage and from the Dt. Bbk extranet. Moreover, Xemac receives daily a CEPH (Central Eurpean Pricing Hub) file from Dt. Bbkand additionally downloads a back-up version from the Dt. Bbk extranet.
 
Eurex sends a daily file with eligibility criteria including prices,haircuts and concentration limits for their contract definitions. In addition, a daily file with Foreign Currency Haircuts is received to be considered in case the deposit currency of an ISIN differs from the claim currency. Moreover, Eurex provides daily an own issue file which specifies per Clearer- /Member-ID combination the issuer numbers that are to be excluded.
 
Eurex StatistiX sends a daily file with the eligibile ISINs for the GCP Baskets including haircut and concentration limit. In addition Eurex StatistiX sends a daily file with prices for ISINs included in the EAD list or in any GCP basket.
 
Xemac sends up to 26 times per day a Margin Requirement file to CCP based on all GC Pooling exposures.

Xentric Trade Machine is a fully fledged algo development platform allowing users to develop their own algorithms for arbitrage trading, proprietary trading and position hedging. Xentric Trade Machine also provides order matching and allows quotation algorithms for Designated Sponsors.

Xentric Quote Source (XQS) provides issuers and specialists a quoting application programming interface to the Börse Frankfurt Zertifikate AG platform (www.zertifikateboerse.de) for certificates and warrants. XQS also has an API interface to allow additional customized solutions. Information on the Xentric Quote Source application programming interface is available in the > member section.

Xentric Inside is Deutsche Börse’s customer portal allowing users to access the Xentric software and related documentation.

Comment: XONTRO is an order routing, trading and settlement system.
DBAG_Long Description:
As an electronic, intermediary-based trading system set up for the German stock exchange floors, XONTRO supports the contraction of trades in all quoted – national and international – securities. At present, about 30% of all cash market transactions executed in Germany are settled via XONTRO.
XONTRO comprises the order routing and trading system XONTRO Order, as well as the trade enrichment and settlement system XONTRO Trade. Thus, XONTRO supports the entire trading work chain, beginning with the electronic order routing, including the intermediary-based pricing functions, and up to the trade settlement functions, as well as forwarding the trades onto the delivery procedures.

Currently the foollwing exchanges are hosted by XONTRO: 
- Berlin
- Düsseldorf
- Hamburg
- Hannover
- Frankfurt
- München. 
 
XONTRO is multi-tennent system and has currenlty one installation for all tennents and in production since 1992.
